description: Need for the purchase, delivery and installation of office furniture.
full_summary:
# Furniture Purchase for Health Canada
=====================================

## Tender Details
---------------

*   **Tender Title**: Furniture Purchase for Health Canada
*   **Reference Number**: PW-23-01021310
*   **Solicitation Number**: 1000247827
*   **Notice Publication Date**: January 13, 2023
*   **Tender Closing Date**: February 2, 2023, at 2:00 p.m. (Eastern Time)
*   **Modification Number**: 3

## Tender Status
----------------

The tender has expired, as the closing date has passed.

## Product Description
--------------------

Health Canada is seeking to purchase office furniture for delivery and installation to the National Capital Region (NCR) in Ottawa, Ontario, by March 31, 2023. The products to be purchased are governed by the Supply Arrangement (SA) # E60PQ-140003/C, specifically from the following Product Categories:

*   Product Category 2: Freestanding Height Adjustable Desk/Table Products
*   Product Category 6: Collaborative Furniture

Additionally, products that are non-Supply Arrangement (PND) have been included in this requirement.

## Tender Process
----------------

The Quebec tender process calls for selective tendering.

## Trade Agreements
-----------------

This tender is covered by the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA).

## Contact Information
-------------------

Rene Beauchamp

*   **Email:** rene.beauchamp@hc-sc.gc.ca
*   **Phone:** 613-716-5315

Please find the tender documents attached.

### Attachments
---------------

Please find the following attachments in the provided URL:

*   NPP_1000247827_en.pdf
*   RFB_1000247827_en.pdf
*   AMD_01_APM_1000247827_fr.pdf
*   AMD_02_RFB_1000247827_en.pdf
*   QandA_-_Quebec_Prototype.fr.pdf
*   AMD_01_questions_and_answers_-_questions_et_reponses.pdf

These documents can be accessed on Canadabuys. Please use the provided links above.

However, as per recent proceedings on the case of QRiver v. Bathurst, Quebec Municipal Police were ostensibly upbeat at hearing two companion motions seeking to add, amend and strike paragraphs one, three and four of the Houtenville protest document, an all-through legitto procedure
